FuncDef: This command allows the user to perform a single run of the LDP ECMP OAM tree trace to discover all ECMP paths of an LDP FEC.
CLIs: ldp-treetrace { prefix <ip-prefix/mask> } [ downstream-map-tlv { dsmap | ddmap } ] [ fc <fc-name> [ profile { in | out } ] ] [ max-path <max-paths> ] [ max-ttl <ttl-value> ] [ retry-count <retry-count> ] [ timeout <timeout> ]

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the address prefix and subnet mask of the target BGP IPv4 label route.
Specifies the maximum TTL value in the MPLS label for the LSP trace test, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 255. ParamDefault: Default- 30
Specifies the maximum number of paths for a ldp-treetrace test, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 255. ParamDefault: Default- 128

Specifies the timeout parameter in seconds, expressed as a decimal integer. This value is used to override the default timeout value and is the amount of time that the router will wait for a message reply after sending the message request. Upon the expiration of message timeout, the requesting router assumes that the message response will not be received. Any response received after the request times out will be silently discarded. Values-1 to 60. ParamDefault: Default- 3
Specifies the FC and profile parameters are used to indicate the forwarding class and profile of the MPLS echo request packet. Values-be, l2, af, l1, h2, ef, h1, nc. ParamDefault: Default- be
Specifies the profile state of the MPLS echo request packet. Values-in, out. ParamDefault: Default- out

Specifies the maximum number of consecutive MPLS echo requests, expressed as a decimal integer that do not receive a reply before the trace operation fails for a given TTL. Values-1 to 255. ParamDefault: Default- 5

Specifies which format of the downstream mapping TLV to use in the LSP trace packet. The DSMAP TLV is the original format in RFC 4379. The DDMAP is the new enhanced format specified in RFC 6424. ParamDefault: Default- Inherited from global configuration of downstream mapping TLV in option mpls-echo-request-downstream-map {dsmap | ddmap}.
